item.title: 美联储主席沃勒呼吁 12 月减息，然后逐次召开会议
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，他主张在 12 月份降息，不过，从 1 月份开始，一旦收到大量经济数据，美国央行可能会更多地采取逐次会议的方式。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said he’s advocating an interest-rate cut in December, though the US central bank can probably take more of a meeting-by-meeting approach starting in January once it receives a flood of economic data.】

item.title: X-Energy 为先进核反应堆设计融资 7 亿美元
item.description: 由亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）支持的先进核技术公司 X-Energy LLC 从简街集团（Jane Street Group）领导的投资者那里筹集了约 7 亿美元，用于将其小型反应堆商业化。【原文：X-Energy LLC, an advanced nuclear technology company backed by Amazon.com Inc., raised some $700 million from investors led by Jane Street Group to commercialize its small reactor.】

item.title: 印度最高法院在达成和解后撤销对桑德萨拉斯的起诉
item.description: 印度最高法院同意撤销对尼廷-桑德萨拉（Nitin Sandesara）和切坦-桑德萨拉（Chetan Sandesara）兄弟的所有刑事指控，这对兄弟曾创建了尼日利亚领先的石油公司之一，在银行欺诈案中同意一次性赔偿 510 亿卢比（5.72 亿美元）。【原文：India’s Supreme Court has agreed to quash all criminal charges against Nitin and Chetan Sandesara, brothers who built one of Nigeria’s leading oil companies, after agreeing to a one-time settlement of 51 billion rupees ($572 million) in a bank fraud case.】

item.title: 巴西经济学家下调 2026 年关键利率预测，因通胀放缓
item.description: 巴西经济学家自 9 月份以来首次下调了 2026 年年末利率预测，原因是通胀率逐步回落，巴西央行坚持其鹰派货币政策立场。【原文：Brazil economists cut their 2026 year-end interest rate forecasts for the first time since September as inflation gradually comes down and the central bank sticks to its hawkish stance on monetary policy.】

item.title: KKR 的 Raj Agrawal 警告人工智能投资热潮中的泡沫
item.description: KKR & Co.的拉吉-阿格拉瓦（Raj Agrawal）说，他也对数据中心和人工智能的过度繁荣表示担忧，公司正在有选择性地降低风险。【原文：KKR & Co.’s Raj Agrawal said he’s among those concerned about excess exuberance in data centers and artificial intelligence and that the firm is being selective to mitigate risk.】

item.title: 墨西哥本月初通胀加速超过预期
item.description: 在墨西哥央行重申对物价持续上涨的担忧之后，墨西哥 11 月初的年度通胀加速度超过了预期。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation accelerated more than expected in early November after the central bank reiterated concerns of persistent price increases.】

item.title: 谷歌在最新双子座更新中让人工智能构建用户界面
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，奥斯汀-卡尔（Austin Carr）将探讨谷歌决定将界面设计外包给其不断发展的双子座工具。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at Google’s decision to outsource interface design to its ever-evolving Gemini tools.】

item.title: 人工智能产业建立在一个未经证实的重大假设之上
item.description:
除了预测人工智能将达到通用水平并取代数以百万计的人类工作者之外，我们还考虑到了人工智能芯片的寿命问题。【原文：

In addition to the projections about reaching artificial general intelligence and replacing millions of human workers, there’s the mundane matter of how long AI chips will last.

】

item.title: 美联储尚未准备好效仿格林斯潘押注科技繁荣
item.description: 全球经济正盲目飞向人工智能革命。【原文：The global economy is flying blind into the AI revolution.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税为何阻碍了美国工厂的就业
item.description: 特朗普仍对推动美国工厂复兴所需的外国制造机器征收关税【原文：Trump still has tariffs on foreign-made machines needed to fuel a US factory revival】

item.title: Blackstone 支持的 Beacon Offshore 通过新油井在美国海湾下注
item.description: Beacon Offshore Energy LLC 是一家由 Blackstone Inc. 支持的石油勘探公司，该公司将赌注押在墨西哥湾的钻井复兴上，因为它将利用新技术启动美国一些产量最高的油井，以抽取曾经无法到达的原油。【原文：Beacon Offshore Energy LLC, an oil explorer backed by Blackstone Inc., is betting on a drilling renaissance in the Gulf of Mexico as it starts up some of the most productive wells in the US using new technology to pump once-impossible-to-reach crude.】

item.title: 即使以加密货币的标准来看，比特币的暴跌也是残酷的
item.description:
对于比特币死忠来说，命运的逆转已经不是什么新鲜事了。但这次不同。【原文：

Reversals of fortune are nothing new for Bitcoin diehards. But this time is different.

】

item.title: 印度央行行长称存在降息空间后印度债券上涨
item.description: 印度储备银行行长桑杰-马尔霍特拉（Sanjay Malhotra）表示，最新数据表明存在降息空间，印度债券涨幅扩大。【原文：Indian bonds extended gains after the Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the latest data suggests there’s scope for an interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 汇丰银行认为埃及镑在贬值后将赢得投资者信任
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holding Plc）首席地区经济学家表示，埃及镑正在赢得外国债务投资者的信任，如果埃及进一步降息，这些投资者可能不会望而却步。【原文：Egypt’s pound is gaining the trust of foreign debt-investors who likely won’t be deterred if the nation makes deeper interest-rate cuts, according to HSBC Holding Plc’s chief regional economist.】

item.title: 大科技公司的人工智能债务浪潮有可能淹没信贷市场
item.description: 大科技公司大量抛售债务有可能使买家不堪重负，并可能削弱大西洋两岸的信贷市场。【原文：A flood of debt sales from Big Tech risks overwhelming buyers and could weaken the credit market on both sides of the Atlantic.】

item.title: 科特迪瓦供应强劲，可可跌幅扩大至 21 个月低点
item.description: 纽约可可期货跌幅扩大至2024年2月以来的最低点，原因是头号种植国象牙海岸出口到港口的可可数量强劲，预示着供应前景将有所改善。【原文：Cocoa futures extended losses to the lowest since February 2024 in New York, as robust deliveries to ports for export from top grower Ivory Coast signaled a better supply outlook.】

item.title: 文件显示，亚马逊数据中心数量在人工智能狂潮中突破 900 个
item.description: 据彭博社和调查网站 SourceMaterial 审查的文件显示，亚马逊公司的数据中心运营规模远比人们通常理解的要大，在 50 多个国家共有 900 多个设施。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s data center operation is much larger than commonly understood, totaling more than 900 facilities in more than 50 countries, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg and investigative website SourceMaterial.】

item.title: 美联储专注于人工智能— 但还没准备好下格林斯潘规模的赌注
item.description: 和其他人一样，美联储的政策制定者们也越来越痴迷于人工智能及其为经济注入 "涡轮增压 "的承诺。只是他们还没有准备好发出革命正在进行的重大信号。【原文：Like everyone else, policymakers at the Federal Reserve are increasingly obsessed with artificial intelligence and its promise of a turbocharged economy. They’re just not ready to make a big call that the revolution is under way.】

item.title: 股票交易者驾驭高风险英国预算指南
item.description: 英国财政大臣蕾切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）正在寻求大约 300 亿英镑（390 亿美元）的资金，以填补公共财政的漏洞并恢复财政信誉，股票投资者正准备迎接英国多年来最受瞩目的预算案之一。【原文：Equity investors are bracing for one of the most keenly anticipated UK budgets in years, as Chancellor Rachel Reeves looks for an estimated £30 billion ($39 billion) to plug a hole in the public finances and restore fiscal credibility.】

item.title: Eskom 主席称世界电网改造可能增加南非成本
item.description: 南非国有电力公司主席表示，全球对输电线路的需求将影响南非对 4,400 亿兰特（约合 254 亿美元）国家电网升级计划的承受能力。【原文：Global demand for transmission lines will affect the affordability of South Africa’s plan for a 440 billion-rand ($25.4 billion) national power-grid upgrade, according to the chair of the state-owned utility.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 AlKhorayef 石油公司据称准备首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，沙特阿拉伯 AlKhorayef 集团已开始为其石油和天然气服务子公司的潜在上市做准备。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s AlKhorayef Group has started preparations for a potential listing of its oil and gas services subsidiary, according to people familiar with the matter, adding to the list of companies looking to go public in the kingdom.】

item.title: 一周剧烈波动考验各股支撑位
item.description: 连续第三周的市场动荡让美国股市投资者在通常是股市强劲的季节性行情到来之前，寻找如何布局的优势。【原文：A third straight week of market turbulence left US equity investors searching for any edge on how to position ahead of what is normally a strong seasonal stretch for stocks.】

item.title: 据说意大利正在探索建立网络中心以保护敏感资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，意大利正在考虑建立一个由政府支持的网络安全实体，该项目可能会利用收购来加强敏感的数字基础设施。【原文：Italy is considering the creation of a government-backed cybersecurity entity, a project that would potentially use acquisitions to strengthen sensitive digital infrastructure, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧洲国防股跌至近两个月低点，涨势减弱
item.description: 欧洲股市今年涨势的主要推动力正在迅速回落。【原文：A key driver of this year’s gains in European stocks is falling back fast.】

item.title: Stellantis 提高雪铁龙产量，满足经济型轿车需求
item.description: Stellantis NV 正在提高雪铁龙汽车的产量，这要归功于 C3 城市汽车的需求高于预期，以及法国品牌克服了质量障碍和产品管道中的缺口。【原文：Stellantis NV is raising production of Citroëns thanks to higher-than-expected demand for the C3 city car with the French brand overcoming quality snags and gaps in the product pipeline.】

item.title: 德意志银行通过出售额外一级资本寻求新资本
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）正寻求在目前炙手可热的初级银行债券市场上发行新的附加一级债券。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG is looking to print a new Additional Tier 1 bond in what is currently hot market for junior bank debt.】

item.title: 南非看到欧洲债券回归的 "甜蜜点
item.description: 南非财政部副部长表示，投资者情绪的改善为南非重返欧元债券市场创造了机会。【原文：South Africa’s deputy finance minister said improved investor sentiment has created an opportunity for the country to return to the eurobond market.】

item.title: 泰国斥资 150 亿美元推进停滞项目以刺激经济增长
item.description: 泰国打赌，加快推进 4,800 亿泰铢（约合 148 亿美元）的停滞投资项目将有助于支持经济发展势头，因为泰国正努力与本地区其他国家争夺外国资本。【原文：Thailand is betting that speeding up 480 billion baht ($14.8 billion) in stalled investment projects will help support economic momentum as it races to compete with regional peers for foreign capital.】

item.title: 核电输出强劲，法国电力出口创 20 年新高
item.description: 由于核电和可再生能源的强劲输出，法国在 7 月至 10 月期间出口了至少二十年来最多的电力。【原文：France exported the most electricity in at least two decades from July to October due to strong nuclear and renewables output.】

item.title: 比利时达成预算协议，避免政治动荡
item.description: 比利时五党联盟周一早些时候达成预算协议，避免了政府垮台的可能，并在未来几周的几项关键决策前确保了一些急需的政治稳定。【原文：Belgium’s five-party coalition sealed a budget deal early on Monday, averting a possible government collapse and securing some much-needed political stability before several key decisions in the coming weeks.】
